column4: Hey there. I'm going through hell right now over what seems to be a serious bug with this dell laptop.
The "fn" key is stuck enabled as soon as GNOME starts. I can't seem to untoggle it. It doesn't pose a problem at the GDM screen.
This is a customer's laptop. I'm converting them to Ubuntu for a fee, and my job is basically at stake if I can't fix this.
It is very hard to type while holding the fn key down with my pinky. right now half my keyboard is a number pad.
-> what do you consider as your gdm screen?
the login screen of course. GNOME takes priority inside of GDM from there on.
-> when you do a  gconf-editor  and then drill down to /desktop/gnome/accessability/keyboard  can you read off your settings? what is checked?
-> when you do a  gconf-editor  and then drill down to /desktop/gnome/accessability/keyboard  can you read off your settings? what is checked?
-> people can correct me if i mis-inform you
It's hard to type with this keyboard the way it is. Are there any particular settings you're interested in? This is a default configuration.
-> nothing in particular, more of comparing to mine, where function keys are okay
seeing as fn keys tend to be a hardware feature and there seems to be no relevant setting in this set, I don't think it'll help... The only non-beep thing is "stickykeys_two_key_off"
-> you can run  xwininfo  and get the id, then   xwd -id 0xyyyyyy > saveimage  then post saveimage in pastebin or somewhere an image can be posted
-> well, if you already have determined that, then am of no help then
